Text saved: Older scary movies often show main characters in desperate situations, and it was very hard for them to call for help or call the police. Today, cell phones make that scene feel less realistic, because the audience expects a phone to work. The way to keep the suspense is to remove the signal. In a scary film it is nearly sure that at a crucial moment, just when the main character really needs to call for help, there will be no signal at all, or the phone’s power will run out while the call is being made, or both.

Text saved: Older horror films often show protagonists in very difficult situations, and it is hard or impossible for them to call for help or call the police. Mobile phones have made that situation a little less believable now. What is the solution to keep the suspense? No phone coverage! If you are a hero in a horror film, it is almost certain that at a key moment, just when you really need to call for help, you will have no coverage at all. Or the phone’s battery will die while the character is making the call, or both.
